      • getTaskExecutor

        protected org.springframework.core.task.AsyncTaskExecutor getTaskExecutor()

      • setTaskExecutor

        public void setTaskExecutor(org.springframework.core.task.AsyncTaskExecutor taskExecutor)

      • getBackOffTime

        public long getBackOffTime()
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds the polling thread must wait before trying to recover when an error occurs (e.g. connection timeout)

      • setBackOffTime

        public void setBackOffTime(long backOffTime)
        The number of milliseconds the polling thread must wait before trying to recover when an error occurs (e.g. connection timeout). Default is 10000 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        backOffTime - in milliseconds

      • getQueueStopTimeout

        public long getQueueStopTimeout()
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds the stop(String) method waits for a queue to stop before interrupting the current thread. Default value is 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

      • setQueueStopTimeout

        public void setQueueStopTimeout(long queueStopTimeout)
        The number of milliseconds the stop(String) method waits for a queue to stop before interrupting the current thread. Default value is 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).
        Parameters:
        queueStopTimeout - in milliseconds

      • createDefaultTaskExecutor

        protected org.springframework.core.task.AsyncTaskExecutor createDefaultTaskExecutor()
        Create a default TaskExecutor. Called if no explicit TaskExecutor has been specified.

        The default implementation builds a SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor with the specified bean name (or the class name, if no bean name specified) as thread name prefix.

        Returns:
        a SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor configured with the thread name prefix
        See Also:
        SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor.SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor(String)

      • executeMessage

        protected void executeMessage(org.springframework.messaging.Message<String> stringMessage)

      • stop

        public void stop(String logicalQueueName)
        Stops and waits until the specified queue has stopped. If the wait timeout specified by getQueueStopTimeout() is reached, the current thread is interrupted.
        Parameters:
        logicalQueueName - the name as defined on the listener method

      • stopQueue

        protected void stopQueue(String logicalQueueName)

      • start

        public void start(String logicalQueueName)

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning(String logicalQueueName)
        Checks if the spinning thread for the specified queue logicalQueueName is still running (polling for new messages) or not.
        Parameters:
        logicalQueueName - the name as defined on the listener method
        Returns:
        true if the spinning thread for the specified queue is running otherwise false.

      • getAmazonSqs

        protected com.amazonaws.services.sqs.AmazonSQSAsync getAmazonSqs()

      • setAmazonSqs

        public void setAmazonSqs(com.amazonaws.services.sqs.AmazonSQSAsync amazonSqs)
        Configures the mandatory AmazonSQS client for this instance. Note:The configured instance should have a buffering amazon SQS instance (see subclasses) functionality to improve the performance during message reception and deletion on the queueing system.
        Parameters:
        amazonSqs - the amazon sqs instance. Must not be null

      • getDestinationResolver

        protected org.springframework.messaging.core.DestinationResolver<String> getDestinationResolver()

      • setDestinationResolver

        public void setDestinationResolver(org.springframework.messaging.core.DestinationResolver<String> destinationResolver)
        Configures the destination resolver used to retrieve the queue url based on the destination name configured for this instance.
        This setter can be used when a custom configured DestinationResolver must be provided. (For example if one want to have the DynamicQueueUrlDestinationResolver with the auto creation of queues set to true.
        Parameters:
        destinationResolver - - the destination resolver. Must not be null

      • getBeanName

        protected String getBeanName()

      • setBeanName

        public void setBeanName(String name)
        Specified by:
        setBeanName in interface org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware

      • getMaxNumberOfMessages

        protected Integer getMaxNumberOfMessages()

      • setMaxNumberOfMessages

        public void setMaxNumberOfMessages(Integer maxNumberOfMessages)
        Configure the maximum number of messages that should be retrieved during one poll to the Amazon SQS system. This number must be a positive, non-zero number that has a maximum number of 10. Values higher then 10 are currently not supported by the queueing system.
        Parameters:
        maxNumberOfMessages - the maximum number of messages (between 1-10)

      • getVisibilityTimeout

        protected Integer getVisibilityTimeout()

      • setVisibilityTimeout

        public void setVisibilityTimeout(Integer visibilityTimeout)
        Configures the duration (in seconds) that the received messages are hidden from subsequent poll requests after being retrieved from the system.
        Parameters:
        visibilityTimeout - the visibility timeout in seconds

      • setResourceIdResolver

        public void setResourceIdResolver(org.springframework.cloud.aws.core.env.ResourceIdResolver resourceIdResolver)
        This value must be set if no destination resolver has been set.
        Parameters:
        resourceIdResolver - the resourceIdResolver to use for resolving logical to physical ids in a CloudFormation environment. Must not be null.

      • getWaitTimeOut

        protected Integer getWaitTimeOut()

      • setWaitTimeOut

        public void setWaitTimeOut(Integer waitTimeOut)
        Configures the wait timeout that the poll request will wait for new message to arrive if the are currently no messages on the queue. Higher values will reduce poll request to the system significantly.
        Parameters:
        waitTimeOut - - the wait time out in seconds

      • isAutoStartup

        Specified by:

      • setAutoStartup

        public void setAutoStartup(boolean autoStartup)
        Configures if this container should be automatically started. The default value is true
        Parameters:
        autoStartup - - false if the container will be manually started

      • setPhase

        public void setPhase(int phase)
        Configure a custom phase for the container to start. This allows to start other beans that also implements the SmartLifecycle interface.
        Parameters:
        phase - - the phase that defines the phase respecting the Ordered semantics
